text: <@U3Y6QC58U|chpetersen> has joined the channel
Is there any pdf library with text to speech functionality ? :face_with_rolling_eyes:
text to speech isn't a simple field
try to check sphinx
well TTS is built into Android, has been since about forever. For any PDF related queries I suggest you ask <@U1HLABD1S>  - he  works at PSPDFKit
<https://github.com/nextdimension/superlightstack>

attachments.title: nextdimension/superlightstack
attachments.text: superlightstack - A lightweight library which helps to create a view stack as a replacement for fragments and activities, provides transitions and persistence

text: oooh that’s yours? dope
Niceee!!!
Starred!
<@U0BGDHB6E|fgsguedes> has left the channel
Yet another library that replaces fragments
that will inevitably become fragments
Not hating on your lib, i’m just saying that that’s typically the direction that libs like this end up going
<@U08GFT5V5> I know what you're saying and its a valid statement. I just want to keep this library simple, so I will try to avoid it turning into fragments.
mandatory xkcd ref <https://xkcd.com/927/>

attachments.title: Standards
attachments.text: [Title text] "Fortunately, the charging one has been solved now that we've all standardized on mini-USB. Or is it micro-USB? Shit."

text: <@U0N7D6F50> tag standards
:x: Tag *standards* not found!
:thinking_face:
<@U0N7D6F50> tag add standards <https://xkcd.com/927/>
:white_check_mark: Tag *standards* added!
<@U0N7D6F50> tag standards
>>><https://xkcd.com/927/>
:wink:
<@U3YU1CUHL|mario1217> has joined the channel
<@U3XKNGRLH|mailorderpotato> has joined the channel
<@U04UBTWEE> hey hey, I would recommend to not handle errors in `doOnNext` or `doOnError` I guess :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U08GFT5V5> I've never seen any non-fragment-lib become fragment-lib
it takes a ridiculous level of unnecessary complexity to become fragments
<@U091EBYSU> when i switchMap to a retrofit observable, i need to handle errors and prefer not to use a bus ;(
on calling a retrofit endpoint how do u show progress to the user and stop the progress?

<@U04UBTWEE> well I’m not saying that you should use bus :slightly_smiling_face: We’ve got rid of raw errors by turning them into values.

To show/stop progress you can simply share the stream and subscribe to it several times
mmm does your observable have something like `Pair<SuccessResult, FailureResult>` ?
very interesting
What is the actual return type from retrofit since it can return `Result.Success` or `Result.Error` ? or do you use a converter to transform throwables to Result Error?
<@U091EBYSU> есть штука, которая называется doOnSubscribe и doOnTerminate

<@U04UBTWEE> this is ~how it looks like in our codebase, for Result.Success/Error we use kotlin `sealed class`es, `ofType` is also our extension which is `filter { it is requiredClass}` + `cast(RequiredClass)`, hope you get it :slightly_smiling_face:
oh i dont use kotlin, java only :disappointed:
<@U04UBTWEE> doesn’t matter

<@U3J6W9P0W> english please, it’s international chat. Yup, there are `doOnSubscribe` and `doOnTerminate` , we prefer to not do such side effects if possible and create separate chains with separate  `observeOn(mainScheduler)` if required instead of jumping through threads for side effects.
<@U091EBYSU> is there a seal class equiv pattern for java in this usage pattern?
<@U04UBTWEE> kotlin is not required for that, just convenience. `sealed class`es could be changed with regular ones just with less type safety

<@U091EBYSU> 
```
observable.doSomeStuffLikeFiltering()
    .observeOn(AndroidSchedulers.mainThread())
    .doOnSubscribe()
    .doOnTerminate()
    .subscribe()
```
oh i like the type safety ;(
<@U3J6W9P0W> so what? It’s up to conventions in your team, we prefer separate subscriptions without side-effects as I said
could i some how, request resume on error with something else, map that, then somehow allow a subscription? i just cant get my finger on it

<@U04UBTWEE> just try easiest solution first and add-up little by little, no need to apply all cool things in one commit :slightly_smiling_face:

There are `onError*`/etc operators for that
I’ve been working with RxUi for 3 months now :wink: the’ve been many commits!
thanks for your time
how come you dont use RxUi in your work projects!? :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U04UBTWEE> damn, it’s pain point for me, we’re currently preparing our MVVM things to open source, hope to inject RxUi in the middle of this migration haha
mmm, do u know of any good MVVM samples in github i can look at?
not sure which ones are decent and use rxjava
no, most of them use support-databinding which don’t use at all, our one is reactive, hopefully we’ll publish it some time soon
<@U3YJPHZ0U|nolnefm> has joined the channel
<@U091EBYSU> still working for NYT?
<@U061HDV96> no, Juno
Cool, you're having a baby? :troll:
*cough* if you don't get it: <http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0467406/>

attachments.title: Juno (2007)
attachments.text: Directed by Jason Reitman. With Ellen Page, Michael Cera, Jennifer Garner, Jason Bateman. Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes an unusual decision regarding her unborn child.

text: <https://gojuno.com/>

attachments.title: Juno - A Better Ridesharing Service
attachments.text: Juno is refined, responsible, ride sharing. Download Juno app and start riding today. Happy drivers, Happy riders.

text: Damn that is one horrible name for SEO
I could hardly find it were it not for my google-fu
So what's the benefit compared to Lyft and Uber?
For me, the customer.
Could you guys just get somewhere where Uber isn't?
I want some car app in Ghent
Haha, yeah, so TL;TR: we’re caring about drivers even better than Lyft
as result drivers are happy -> riders are happy
Ya I don't buy it till I see it
50% of the company shares reserved for drivers, the more they drive the more equity they get
Just move to Belgium damnit
plus our app is 100% in Kotlin and RxJava, so that’s main plus for you I guess lol
I have an iPhone :kappa:
omg gtfo wtf omg
is it legal in Belgium?
An iPhone or Uber?
an uPhone
either?
oh what a people
Well we don't ban immigrant phones
/gif mic drop
haven’t seen you guys for such awhile
Uber was illegal for a while
we don’t ban immigrant phones either we just delay them :kappa:
back legal
But it's only in brussels
And not for airports
It's bs
Never used it in Belgium
Only used it when I was in the states
iPhone?
Both
you and who?
My imaginary pal
You and your imaginary, pal?
k, jokes are too bad, you’ve seen nothing
Ya you guys are still in the tech bubble
People here care less and less
We just want to get it to market
And if you guys have a hundred?
Who cares?
Everyone who's here first just get a huge boom
And it's never new so I don't really care that much
I've never paid a taxi with my own money
It'll never change
I'll probably get an Uber though
So just get your fucking ass over here
Well I can send you apk if you want :troll:
we have very smooth splash screen, you’ll like it
Splash screen? Wtf?
Didn't you say I'd like the app?
well, we actually load data while it’s playing it’s majestic animations
What data can't be loaded visually?
it was actually quite a hard thing to do
backend configs?
But do those need to be available immediately?
But I get you
yup, we need to know what servers to talk to and other stuff, also location (not blocking though)
We do it for the business app, but that only has to be started once a day or something luckily
You need to know what servers to talk to?
Explain that to me
well, you must see our splash, it really worth to look at for 1-2 seconds
like where from to get static files, localization and so on, then if we have auth token we’ll try to pre fetch lost of stuff so main screen will be ready asap
the problem was to make all this background operations work without affecting splash animation, it’s not static image
Static files and localisation, what do you need static files for and why do you need to preload some stuff for localisation?
I'm sure you have a good reason, I'm not pointing a finger. Just want to know.
files are images, localization — we have some parts of it on backend (with local cache), so product people can change it without reuploading apps to stores
Alright, I guess those images change often then?
oh and forgout about feature flags, there are some global and some per user
no, images are pretty static, but we need to know base urls and all that stuff, caching is done mostly by okhttp
Personally I don't see why you wouldn't just put it in the APK
Same for localisations
You'll probably lose your splash screen
business want to change things on fly and they do, for example for things like Christmas and Halloween
Alright, sounds like a hassle for you though
We would steel need at least global feature flags
Global feature flags?
it dictates how we should do sign up flow for example
yup, many things are runtime-configurable
So you'd sign ppl up differently based on location?
if backend would want to yes, either invite or regular mode and such kind of stuff
Alright cool
kk, I’m going to bed, while we’re in <#C054ZUY2W|libraries> check out `mainframer`: a tool for remote builds we’ve made <https://github.com/gojuno/mainframer>

attachments.title: gojuno/mainframer
attachments.text: mainframer - TL;TR: sync project to remote machine, execute commands, sync project back.

text: <@U3YHJNGUB|amanjeetsingh150> has joined the channel

Hello, i faced an issue with RxJava2 on low sdk versions(16-21). Crash log says 
`    java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io.reactivex.internal.schedulers.TrampolineScheduler at io.reactivex.internal.operators.observable.ObservableObserveOn.subscribeActual(ObservableObserveOn.java:39) at io.reactivex.Observable.subscribe(Observable.java:10685) at io.reactivex.Observable.subscribe(Observable.java:10671) at io.reactivex.Observable.subscribe(Observable.java:10600) ` or 
`    Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: io.reactivex.schedulers.Schedulers$1 at io.reactivex.schedulers.Schedulers.<clinit>(Schedulers.java:64) ` . I am on latest buildTools=25.0.2, compileSdk=25, RxJava=2.0.5. Clean build, disabling `android.enableBuildCache`. Nothing helps. Had someone faced such issue and knows ways to fix it? Google or SO tells nothing valuable.
